page.title: 08 Farming
page.content: There are 2 major land owners Williams of Werrington and Coode of Lanhydrock, some farms are owner occupied. Modern machinery results in less man hours and leads to decline of rural life. Weather,once the factor in control, is usurped by disease laws and {EEC}trade restrictions on farming methods. A mixed farming area beef, lamb,pork and milk,few cash crops.{Friesian herds predominate,beef reared for profit depends on veterinary skills and drug companies to reach standards for government subsidy.The milk quota idea is reluctantly accepted.If a farmer wants to increase or decrease his out put he must sell his existing farm and buy one with the quota needed.Returns on milk are good many depend on the monthly cheque from{MMB.}Farms are not self-sufficient in feed stuffs,animals are housed for 6 months of the year.
